intro: Riedelia dolichopteron, commonly known as the long-stemmed riedelia, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fibrous roots help it retain moisture in dry conditions, and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Riedelia dolichopteron is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that adds ornamental value to gardens in suitable climates.
